newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek bourse rebounds 1.37 pct after Thurs plunge.
newsitem.headline: Greek bourse rebounds 1.37 pct after Thurs plunge.

text.p: The Athens bourse defied the bears and rebounded by a strong 1.37 percent to make up about half of Thursday's 3.31 percent plunge in moderate volume of 6.06 billion drachmas.

It was the second normal session since a settlement scandal halted trading for almost four days, and brokers and analysts predicted that it would take time to repair the negative impact on market sentiment.

"We had signs of corruption with the recent crisis at the bourse -- you can't fool everyone all the time. We experienced light redemptions but such impacts take a longer time to be felt by mutual funds," said Phaedon Tamvakakis, managing director of Hambros Hellenic Mutual Funds.
Meanwhile, sources told Reuters the resignation of four of the five board members of the exchange's guarantee fund was imminent over a stock exchange draft bill released on Friday.
According to their interpretation the bill sets a loophole for the clearing house to avoid paying its part -- 1.3 billion drachmas -- of the Delta Securities default.
Banks gained 1.33 percent, industrials climbed 2.24 percent with construction edging uo 0.28 percent. Small-caps ended 1.65 percent higher.
Advancers led decliners 120 to 82 with 19 issues unchanged on 221 traded.
